info.title: Clockwork SMS
info.description: The HTTP interface to send text messages can be accessed using GET or POST. All parameters must be URL Encoded and sent as UTF-8 text.

get.description: Returns the firehose of fundraising companies on AngelList. Results are paginated and ordered by the date on which the round was listed.
Search links receiving clicks across bitly by content, language, location, and more.

parameters.name: cities
parameters.description: show links active in this city (ordered like country-state-city, e.g. us-il-chicago).

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: restrict results to this web domain (like bitly.com).

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: which fields to return in the response (comma-separated). May be any of: domain, initial_epoch, h2, h3, site, lastindexed, keywords, last_indexed_epoch, title, initial, summaryText, content, score, summaryTitle, type, description, cities, lang, url, referrer, aggregate_link, lastseen, page, ogtitle, aggregate_link. By default, all will be returned.

parameters.name: full_domain
parameters.description: restrict results to this full web domain (like blog.bitly.com).

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description: favor results in this language (two letter ISO code).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: which result to start with (defaults to 0).

get.description: The Clickatell HTTP/S API provides just about the simplest way of programming your connection to Clickatell, and if you need to overcome a firewall problem HTTP/S is almost certainly your best solution.
The HTTP interface to send text messages can be accessed using GET or POST. All parameters must be URL Encoded and sent as UTF-8 text.

parameters.name: Content
parameters.description: The message you want to send. Mobile networks only support characters listed in the GSM character set, but for consistency all characters must be UTF-8 encoded when sending through the API.

parameters.name: From
parameters.description: The text or phone number displayed when a text message is received on a phone. This can be either a 12 digit number or 11 characters long. You can set a default by logging in to Clockwork.

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: Your API key, available by logging in (with your username and password) to Clockwork.

parameters.name: Long
parameters.description: Set this to 1 and we’ll stick together multiple messages giving you up to 459 characters, rather than the standard 160 (each recipient will cost up to 3 message credits)

parameters.name: total
parameters.description: Up to 50 comma separated numbers. Each number should start with an international country code without any leading zeros or plus symbols.
